title: Philadelphia Marble Brownies Recipe
description: Marble brownies are a decadent dessert. Rich chocolate brownie batter is swirled with sweet cream cheese, getting high marks in both appearance and taste!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Philadelphia Marble Brownies 4.7 (74) 49 Reviews 19 Photos These rich marble brownies are a quick and easy dessert with your favorite brownie mix. Chocolate brownie batter is mixed with a sweetened cream cheese mixture for an elegant appearance. Store in the refrigerator. Submitted by Philadelphia Updated on November 1, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 32 Yield: 32 brownies Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 32 servings 1 (18.4 ounce) package brownie mix ½ cup vegetable oil 3 large eggs, divided 3 tablespoons water 1 (8 ounce) package Philadelphia cream cheese, softened ⅓ cup white sugar ½ teaspoon vanilla Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan. Stir brownie mix, oil, 2 eggs, and water together in a medium bowl until well blended. Pour into the prepared pan. Beat cream cheese in a bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar, remaining egg, and vanilla; mix until well combined. Drop tablespoonfuls cream cheese mixture over brownie batter, then swirl with a knife. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the chocolate brownies comes out clean and the cream cheese mixture is lightly browned, 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool completely before cutting into 32 squares. Recipe Tips For best results, do not use a brownie mix with a syrup pouch.You can use Philadelphia Neufchâtel cheese instead of regular cream cheese.Sprinkle 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chunks over brownie batter before baking if desired. I Made It Print 111 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Philadelphia Marble Brownies 01 of 19 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 19 Photo by  Sandra 02/16/2025 Too much cream cheese mixture although I used a Canadian brownie mix which was 3 ounces less than the US recipe. 03 of 19 Photo by  janet-dunlap 06/19/2024 I thoroughly used my mixer on the cream cheese mixture and must have overdone it, because by the time I mixed in the egg and vanilla, it was very thin with the consistancy of sweetened condensed milk. It was very difficult to swirl such a thin mixture with the much thicker brownie. Next time, I would reserve a cup of the brownie mixture to put over the cream cheese mixture (as others have recommended).I baked it 35 minutes in a glass baking dish, but would test it after 30 minutes as the edges were to firm for my taste. 04 of 19 Photo by  James McCanless 11/29/2019 05 of 19 Photo by  Donna 09/12/2018 06 of 19 Photo by  rileysmama 03/24/2018 It was good! I should have doubled my batch of brownies (did not want to run to the store for a mix, so did homemade), but that did not affect how awesome these were! Also, I used the size pan required for the brownies, not the 13x9 it calls for here (totally spaced & missed that), so they took longer to cook. However, 100% will make again and will do it correctly! Ha ha! They were amazing like it was, I can only imagine if I do it correctly! 07 of 19 Photo by  Koumiko 09/07/2016 08 of 19 Photo by  Daletia Evans 03/09/2016 09 of 19 Photo by  yamama 09/20/2015 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Red Velvet Cheesecake Brownies 147 Ratings Raspberry Fudge Brownies 125 Ratings Chunky Cheesecake Brownies 697 Ratings Marble Squares II 13 Ratings Masala Chai Brownies 51 Ratings Layers Of Love Chocolate Brownies 32 Ratings Wonderful Brownies 41 Ratings Brooke's Best Bombshell Brownies 5,062 Ratings 'So This Is What Heaven Tastes Like!' Drop tablespoonfuls cream cheese mixture over brownie batter, then swirl with a knife.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the chocolate brownies comes out clean and the cream cheese mixture is lightly browned, 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool completely before cutting into 32 squares.
